overview.about-body: The Solar Dashboard is an interactive online experience to help Pacific Gas and Electric’s solar customers track and understand their electricity bill.
overview.role-body: I led the design of this project with oversight from David Royer, Senior UX Designer at Opower. I was responsible for all phases of the design process including; research, wireframing, user testing, visual design and documentation.

intro.title: Billing for solar customers works differently.
intro.body1: Utility bills can be confusing. This is epecially true for Pacific Gas and Electric (PG&E) customers who own solar panels. Their billing works differently than most because they pay for their electricity usage just once a year instead of every month.
intro.body2: Our goal was to create a unique online experience for these users to help increase customer satisfaction and reduce call center costs related to bill confusion

current-experience.body: To gain an understanding of the current experience for solar customers I conducted an audit of PGE's webite as well as the  paper statements customers recieve in the mail each month.
current-experience.conclusion: I found that there was a large disconnect between the information a user sees online and what they get in the mail.

user-research.body: I worked with the Opower Research team to recruit and interview 6 real PG&E solar customer in order understand how they think about their bill
user-research.conclusion: Based on the research, I assembled a customer journey map to better understand the context of how a user would experience PG&E’s website.

sketching.body: Using what I learned from the research I started an interative process of sketching starting with user flows and moving into higher fidelity wireframes. During this process I held work/critique sessions with the Opower UX team.

prototyping.body: From my wireframes I created high fidelity prototypes with limited interactivity. Since clear communication was essential to the success of this design, I wanted to test with proper visual hierarchy
